title: MAKE FUN OF JAVASCRIPT ARRAY
description: A short chapter on JavaScript arrays where you can learn everything about JavaScript arrays. Few things are very important in JavaScript and arrays are one of them. Whatever you do, working in JavaScript requires a good understanding of arrays and objects. In this short chapter we will learn all about arrays in detail. I will implement most of the methods of array and try to understand its use professionally. We think that after a good completion of this short course, there will be no more confusion about arrays in JavaScript. JavaScript typed arrays are array-like objects that provide a mechanism for reading and writing raw binary data in memory buffers. Array objects grow and shrink dynamically and can have any JavaScript value. JavaScript engines perform optimizations so that these arrays are fast.

title: Understand ReactJS Core Features - Absolute Beginner
description: React is a UI library used to create interactive user interfaces. For frontend development using React you will need numerous other tools. Most tutorials don't focus on React's fundamental concepts while teaching complete frontend development. As a result of which problems are faced later. In this chunk we have only emphasized on the fundamentals of React. So that you have a good idea about React and you can think like React. React allows developers to create large web applications that can change data, without reloading the page. The main purpose of React is to be fast, scalable, and simple. It works only on user interfaces in the application. This corresponds to the view in the MVC template..

title: Javascript: All You Need to Know
description: The course is designed in such a way that everyone from beginners to experts in programming can benefit from it. The first few chapters discuss the fundamentals of programming. This is followed by a discussion of three important topics in JavaScript: arrays, objects, and functions. Then gradually advanced concepts such as functional programming, object oriented programming, scope, closure, prototype, asynchronous programming, dom manipulation are discussed. Along with this, the many uses of JavaScript are also discussed and demonstrated practically. You can add properties to almost everything. Functions are objects. for.in loops iterate over property names, not values. Variable scoping. Variables that aren't explicitly declared can be global. Understand how .prototype works.

title: Dive Into NodeJS: A Beginner Approach to Lean NodeJS
description: It is only a matter of time to learn NodeJS and develop large web applications using NodeJS with only knowledge of JavaScript. Because this course is designed in such a way that even if you don't have the slightest idea about backend development, you will learn how to develop a blog site for yourself, a company website or even an e-commerce site at the end of the course. Along with this, this course also shows how to create a dashboard. The main subject matter of this course is to develop multipage web applications and complete web development using NodeJS. It is used for server-side programming, and primarily deployed for non-blocking, event-driven servers, such as traditional web sites and back-end API services, but was originally designed with real-time, push-based architectures in mind. Every browser has its own version of a JS engine.

title: ExpressJS Crash Course By Mahin
description: This crash course is a short course on Express which is completely free for you to watch and learn. This course can be the first step to start web development using NodeJS where web development using ExpressJS is shown through a small project. What Is Express JS? Express is a node js web application framework that provides broad features for building web and mobile applications. It is used to build a single page, multipage, and hybrid web application. It's a layer built on the top of the Node js that helps manage servers and routes.

title: The C Programming Complete Course in Bangla
description: The C programming language is a general-purpose, operating system-agnostic, and procedural language that supports structured programming and provides low-level access to the system memory. C programming language uses blocks to separate pieces of code performing different tasks. This helps make programming easier and keeps the code clean. Thus, the code is easy to understand even for those who are starting out. C is used in embedded programming, which is used to control micro-controllers. C is a general purpose computer programming language developed in 1972 by Dennis Ritchie at the Bell Telephone Laboratories for use with the Unix operating system. It was named 'C' because many of its features were derived from an earlier language called 'B'.
